name: Raita
history: Raita is a traditional Indian side dish often made with dahi (yogurt) and various raw or cooked vegetables, fruits, and spices. It's known for its cooling effect and is often served as an accompaniment to spicy dishes.
description: Raita is a creamy and refreshing yogurt-based condiment that can include a variety of vegetables like cucumber or fruits like pineapple. It's seasoned with spices like cumin and sometimes garnished with fresh herbs. Raita helps balance spicy flavors in a meal.

instructions.title: Combine Ingredients
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. Add the grated cucumber, chopped tomato, and onion.

instructions.title: Season the Raita
instructions.description: Stir in the roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, chaat masala, and salt. Mix well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Chill
instructions.description: Garnish the raita with chopped coriander and mint leaves. Refrigerate for a while before serving to enhance the flavors.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the raita chilled as a side dish with biryani, pulao, or any Indian meal.

tips: Use fresh, thick yogurt for the best taste and texture.
Adjust the spices according to your taste preferences.
variations: Include other vegetables like bell peppers or carrots.
Experiment with adding fruits like pomegranate or pineapple for a sweet twist.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with extra herbs.
Accompany with a variety of Indian dishes for a complete meal experience.
